intro: Erigeron debilis, commonly known as the slender fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas such as meadows and grasslands. It features slender stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Erigeron debilis is often used in native plant gardens due to its ecological value and low maintenance requirements.
